hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad ibn Abbadah: I pour ablution water on Umar. A second chain reports: Said ibn Sulayman narrated to us from Abu Aqil: He narrated to us from Hafsa ibn Uthman from Qudamah ibn Musa ibn Qudamah from his father from his uncle: Uthman ibn Muzzhan and Umar performed Umrah (lesser pilgrimage) with the Prophet ﷺ.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Abbadah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abbadah al-Basri

narrators.name: Yazid Abu Khalid
narrators.full_name: Yazid ibn Abd al-Rahman Abu Khalid

narrators.name: Abu Aqil
narrators.full_name: Musa ibn Ismail ibn Muslim al-Basri

narrators.name: Hafsa ibn Uthman
narrators.full_name: Hafsa ibn Uthman

narrators.name: Qudamah ibn Musa ibn Qudamah
narrators.full_name: Qudamah ibn Musa ibn Qudamah al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Musa ibn Qudamah
narrators.full_name: Musa ibn Qudamah al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Companion (uncle's name unclear)
narrators.full_name: Uncle of Musa ibn Qudamah (Companion - exact identity unclear)

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple transmission terms using 'an in the chain suggest potential indirectness; final link to Prophet ﷺ through unnamed uncle creates uncertainty about direct transmission

potential_issues.issue: Unclear ultimate link to the Prophet ﷺ
potential_issues.impact: The final link to the Prophet ﷺ is through an unnamed uncle of Musa ibn Qudamah, creating ambiguity about the actual ultimate source and direct transmission

potential_issues.issue: Repeated use of 'an in the chain
potential_issues.impact: Multiple instances of 'an transmission suggest potential indirectness throughout much of the chain
The chain includes multiple levels of familial transmission (grandfather-father-uncle relationships) which creates additional complexity

hadiths.IISGrade: Acceptable
Topics: Umrah (lesser pilgrimage) with the Prophet ﷺ
